alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Laurel, Owsley, northwestern Leslie, west central Perry, Jackson, southwestern Lee and northern Clay Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Booneville to Brazil. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Booneville, Chestnut Gap, Turin, Stay, Lerose, Levi, Scoville, Pebworth, Endee and Vincent around 650 PM EDT. Eversole, Cowcreek, Southfork, Major and Blake around 655 PM EDT. Ricetown, Arnett, Conkling, Taff, Turkey Foot and New Zion around 700 PM EDT. Lucky Fork, Bradshaw, Sebastian, Gobbard, Shop Branch and Trixie around 705 PM EDT. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 30 and 33, and between mile markers 37 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
